newsitem.title: FINLAND: YIT SAYS TO ISSUE FOUR MLN NEW SHARES.
newsitem.headline: YIT SAYS TO ISSUE FOUR MLN NEW SHARES.

text.p: Finnish construction group YIT-Yhtyma Oy said on Tuesday it would issue a preliminary amount of four million new shares to Finnish and international institutional investors, to the public and to its employees.

"The book building period for institutional investors will begin on March 12, 1997 and end on or about March 24, 1997," YIT said in a statement, adding that the board could increase the amount of shares to be issued up to 4.88 million shares.

YIT said the offer price would be announced after the book building period on or about March 25, and the subscription period for the offerings to retail investors and employees would end around March 26.
"The purpose of the share offering is to support YIT's growth strategy, raise its equity ratio, improve the liquidity of the share and expand the shareholder base," it said.
Merita Corporate Finance Oy is issue lead manager, YIT said.
